p.s: The Blogblog post Globalised Environmental Pollution - Causes and Effects, which was written by Ankita Mitra and published in February 2014, is about the damage industrialization deals to planet Earthearth.
The Blogblog post starts with aan emotional tie to the text, by referingreferring to Earthearth as the only (l. 4) planet with conditions for life.
This has the effect of the reader being more likely, to listen to the call to action at the end.
With the metaphor man first began losing control and became victims of his own creation (l. 12) she wants to strengthen the tie again by accusing the reader of being part of the problem.
This gives the impression of the reader being accountable for this situation, while also contributing to the chance of the reader following the call to action.

The exaggeration in line 24f The water we drink and the vegetables all are contaminated today gives the impression, that we are poisoning ourselfesourselves by drinking and eating, which while being true is very exaggerated.
This combined with the metaphor era of mass extinction (l. 27) also adds up to the call to action at the end.
The mention of the Bhopal tragedy combined with the term Over 2000 people including women and children were killed (l. 31) furthermore strengthens the emotional tie to the reader.
The call to action at the end (l. 33-37) expresses the feeling, that the entire world, except for the reader already knows about the menace and has done their part, now it's the readersreader's turn.
In conclusion you can say that it's a very successful Blogblog post since it has a really good emotional tie, uses many stylistic devices to keep the reader interested and calls to action.
